My TeX pages


This project contains my TeX web pages, and my contributions to the

TeX Users Group
 website.


This project is on github as

jfine2358/texpages
.
docs.title: Home

docs.text: This project contains my TeX web pages, and my contributions to the TeX Users Group  website.  This project is on github as jfine2358/texpages .
docs.title: My TeX pages

docs.text:
myTUG


TUG is the 
TeX Users Group
. I am a member (but
not an officer) of TUG.


These pages are 
MY
 suggestions for improving the TUG website. They
are 
NOT
 official TUG pages.


I hope they will help TUG with its web site.


About TeX


TeX is easy to use and excellent for 
typesetting
mathematics

docs.text:
TeX is easy to use and excellent for  typesetting
mathematics
docs.title: About TeX

docs.text:
Mathematics


TeX is easy to use and excellent at typesetting mathematics. For
example, the quadratic equation 
ax^2 + bx +c = 0
 has solutions


  x = \frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2 - 4ac}}{2a}.





With TeX you type math as a sequence, much as you think or say them.
To get this input, type


the quadratic equation \(ax^2 + bx +c = 0\) has solutions
\[
  x = \frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2 - 4ac}}{2a}.
\]




With TeX, you can keep your hands on the keyboard. No more clumsy
fiddling with the trackpad on your laptop.
docs.title: Math

docs.text:
TeX is easy to use and excellent at typesetting mathematics. For
example, the quadratic equation  ax^2 + bx +c = 0  has solutions 
  x = \frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2 - 4ac}}{2a}.   With TeX you type math as a sequence, much as you think or say them.
To get this input, type  the quadratic equation \(ax^2 + bx +c = 0\) has solutions
\[
  x = \frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2 - 4ac}}{2a}.
\]  With TeX, you can keep your hands on the keyboard. No more clumsy
fiddling with the trackpad on your laptop.
